definition: to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲

sentences.english: The fragmentations of teacher beliefs were eventually damage education hope.
sentences.chinese: 教師信奉的支離破碎最終則損毀了教育的希望。

sentences.english: Dear my baron, you're my broken dream.
sentences.chinese: 柯希莫，你是我支離破碎的夢想。

sentences.english: Drug discovery and development efforts are fragmented across the continent.
sentences.chinese: 藥物發現和開發措施在該大陸支離破碎。

sentences.english: Part of the problem is the state is very fragmented.
sentences.chinese: 該州這個問題有部分又恨支離破碎。

sentences.english: And then the dreams break into a million tiny pieces.
sentences.chinese: 然後美夢變得支離破碎，碎成幾百萬個小碎片。

sentences.english: Bodies were blown apart or charred beyond recognition.
sentences.chinese: 屍體被炸得支離破碎，或燒至難以辨認。

sentences.english: But as the body metabolises the alcohol, sleep may become fragmented.
sentences.chinese: 不過因爲你的身體分解了酒精，睡眠會變得支離破碎。

sentences.english: But the trees spun darkness for a wandering beam of sun.
sentences.chinese: 樹影間搖曳着一縷飄忽的陽光，黑暗因此支離。

sentences.english: The police has only a few bitty evidence.
sentences.chinese: 警方僅有一些支離破碎的證據。

sentences.english: The world of 2666 has been irretrievably shattered.
sentences.chinese: 《2666》的世界無法挽救地支離破碎。

sentences.english: The swirling wind caused the entire house to shake and start to fall apart.
sentences.chinese: 旋轉着的風使整個房子搖動起來，並逐漸支離破碎。

sentences.english: A single pieces of memory has make me dream of chain of nightmares.
sentences.chinese: 一種支離破碎的回憶也能讓我魂牽夢繞。

sentences.english: Significantly, the borescope inspections were marked by fragmentation of the process-flow.
sentences.chinese: 顯而易見，孔探的檢查程序被支離破碎地執行了。

sentences.english: Bad translation mutilates the original work.
sentences.chinese: 拙劣的譯本將原作刪改得支離破碎。

sentences.english: PW: Well, it is part of living in a broken, sinful world.
sentences.chinese: 這正如我們生活在這個支離破碎，充滿罪惡的世界。

sentences.english: How did this conflict get so fragmented?
sentences.chinese: 衝突如何變得這麼支離破碎？

definition: to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
see 呂洞賓|吕洞宾[Lu:3 Dong4 bin1]
writing up of official or judicial documents/pettifoggery
to restore old way/to return to the past
see 清風明月|清风明月[qing1 feng1 ming2 yue4]
lit. carpenter's straight line marker/same as 墨斗/fig. rules/rules and regulations
